comment: I was recomended this channel so much, and it did not disapoint.. this is amazing work, thank you for putting in so much effort into your channel!!
Chad I just want to say thank you for helping me building a strong foundation in General Chemistry this quarter! Im going to get an A because you!!
This was incredibly informative and easy to digest. This video alone made getting through my gen chem class seem a lot more doable. Keep on killin’ it!!
Delivered in true Chad form, as always!
Thank you so much our dear teacher

is it safe to assume that the solvent will most likely be water if not stated in the question? Also why is it that we use 80g of H2SO4 solvent when solving for molality, but then when solving for mole fraaction, the 80g of solvent is H2O?
this was so helpful! almost debated skipping it but the example question you brought in tying it with the intensive property and mass percent from earlier video definitely helped!
Hey Chad thanks for the video! Just wondering, when do you expect to release new videos for your Biochemistry course?
Amazing series! Thank you for the excellent work.
Glad you found us - Happy Studying!
You're very welcome and I hope you get that A!
Thank you - glad it helped you!
Glad to hear it, Devika Nair!

My apology Joe.  Releasing the DAT, OAT, and MCAT courses this last summer made my life a LOT busier than I anticipated.  Last year I produced both organic chemistry and high school chemistry playlists, so I thought I'd have time for both general chemistry and biochemistry this year.  So not the case and I had to choose one and unfortunately I went with general chemistry.  So biochem has been delayed until next year. ☹
You're welcome, Welton - and thank you.
